node.title: Oxford shooting survivors file two $100M lawsuits against school district
node.description: The lawsuits claim the school "created the danger and increased the risk of harm that their students would be exposed to."

node.title: F.D.A. Authorizes Pfizer Boosters for 16- and 17-Year-Olds
node.description: The move clears the way for millions of teenagers to receive an additional shot, with a top regulator citing evidence that the effectiveness of two doses is waning in the age group.

node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (December 12)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: The jury has reached a verdict in the Jussie Smollett trial.
node.description: By Julia Jacobs and Mark Guarino

node.title: Barry Harris, Pianist and Devoted Scholar of Bebop, Dies at 91
node.description: For decades, he performed, taught and toured with unflagging devotion. He also helped to lay the foundation for the widespread academic study of jazz.

node.title: The Pennsylvania Senate Candidate Running as the Anti-Dr. Oz
node.description: In the closely watched Pennsylvania Senate race, Val Arkoosh, a doctor in the Democratic primary, sees openings to raise her profile.

node.title: Men Accused of Starting Montana Fires Say They Were Smoking Weed, Shooting Fireworks
node.description: Gavin Coates Munson, 19, is believed to have started both fires responsible for the destruction of 13 homes in Montana and two other teenagers were present.

node.title: Jussie Smollett Guilty on Five of Six Counts for Lying About Hate Crime
node.description: Jurors deliberated for over nine hours before coming to a verdict on Thursday evening.

node.title: Ohio City to Pay $5.75M to 32 People Injured During 2020 Black Lives Matter Protests
node.description: A lawsuit against Columbus describes clashes with police in which demonstrators were beaten, fired on with wooden and rubber bullets and unlawfully arrested.

node.title: Lowe's CEO Marvin Ellison on diversity, vaccines and inflation
node.description: Retailer chief, one of only three Black Fortune 500 CEOs, says companies must improve how they develop talent.

node.title: Ernesta Procope, Pioneering Black Insurance Broker, Dies at 98
node.description: She broke ground in the business as a woman, too, and also in transplanting her firm from Brooklyn to Wall Street.

node.title: Biden Praises Dole for Civility and Comity as He Pleads for Both
node.description: As Bob Dole lay in state in the Capitol, the president and Democratic leaders recalled his appeals for unity, in an unmistakable message to the Republican Party.

node.title: 'It's Not Fair That You Can't Teach': Fatemeh Anvari Removed From Classroom for Wearing Hijab
node.description: Fatemeh Anvari was told she would no longer be allowed to teach because she wore "religious symbols while at work"—a violation of the controversial Bill 21.

node.title: Gov Ron DeSantis Proposes New Budget with $5K Bonus For Police Who Relocate to Florida
node.description: The budget also requested increased salaries for both entry level and experienced law enforcement officers and signing bonuses for state residents joining.

node.title: Kentucky Aims to Tackle Nursing Shortage By Increasing School Enrollment, Forgiving Loans
node.description: Governor Andy Beshear issued an executive order on Thursday, as well as new proposals set to be included in the proposed state budget.

node.title: Customer Throws Drink at Drive-Thru Worker Over Shortchange in Viral Video
node.description: The employee then threw the customer's food into their car and immediately closed the drive-thru window.

node.title: California Plans More Roadside Monitors to Test Real-Time Pollution Rates of Semi-Trucks
node.description: State regulators will consider increased regulations on emissions from semi-trucks, and a ban on the sale of new small gas engine products like leaf blowers.

node.title: Three All Blacks, one Black Fern make teams of the year
node.description: Three All Blacks have been included in World Rugby's Men's team of the year, while just one Black Fern makes the women's team.

node.title: Sundance returns to Park City, Utah – and also to a laptop or VR device near you
node.description: The 2022 festival lineup includes 82 features from 28 countries (nearly half by first-time directors), and a slate of streaming and virtual reality presentations accessible from anywhere.

node.title: How Do You Tell the World That Doomsday Has Arrived?
node.description: A new film about a killer comet revives memories of a nail-biting night in The Times newsroom two decades ago.

node.title: Why is Russia So Adamant About Annexing an Independent Ukraine?
node.description: The country continues to struggle to find its place in major world affairs.

node.title: Progressives' Efforts at Immigration Reform Halted as Joe Manchin Withholds Support
node.description: "The bottom line is the parliamentarian, you stick with the parliamentarian, that's all," Manchin told reporters. "You stick on every issue."

node.title: Michigan Diocese Says LGBTQ People Must Repent to Receive Several Sacraments
node.description: The diocese said in a statement that "experiencing feelings of same-sex attraction or gender dysphoria" is not a sin, but "freely acting upon them is."

node.title: 'Hugely disappointed': Carterton's multimillion dollar wastewater ponds damaged
node.description: Rips, punctures, and scratches - extensive damage has been discovered at Carterton District Council's $12.7 million wastewater ponds.

node.title: Verdict reached in Jussie Smollett trial
node.description: A verdict has been reached in the former "Empire" star's trial over an allegedly staged attack.

node.title: Don’t Let ‘Treeson’ Drive You Out of New York City
node.description: Not everyone can make it in New York.

node.title: Appeals Court Rejects Trump’s Bid to Shield Material From Jan. 6 Inquiry
node.description: A three-judge panel held that Congress’s oversight powers, backed by President Biden’s decision not to invoke executive privilege over the material, outweighed Mr. Trump’s residual secrecy powers.

node.title: Coronavirus Briefing: Boosting older teens
node.description: And supporting a generation of bereaved children.

node.title: Couple Married at Hospice Three Days Before Bride Died of Cancer
node.description: "I'm heart broken that this marriage will be counted in days not years. Don't put things off, tell the people you love that you love them now," Ben wrote on Twitter.

node.title: Woman Suspects Neighbor "Ate" Her Missing Pet Cat in Video Viewed 1M Times
node.description: Footage shared by the TikToker appears shows the neighbor describing the cat as a "delicious morsel."
